intro: Hibbertia angulata, commonly known as the angular hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive angular stems and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in regions of western and southern Australia. Hibbertia angulata produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
